title: Brexit: what happens next? Delay, no deal or general election?
text:
Following the defeat of his short timeline for the Withdrawal Agreement Bill on Tuesday night, Boris Johnson said he would wait for the EU to respond to the UK’s request for an extension under the Benn Act.

For now, the legislation is “paused”, which means it remains at the current stage in its passage through Parliament.

Mr Johnson will speak to the EU and ask them to reject the extension, in the hope that he can pass the deal in the Commons next week, and the UK can leave before Oct 31.

If he is unsuccessful and the EU grants an extension, Mr Johnson will lobby European leaders for a shorter, “technical” extension, which would allow him to try and pass the deal again under a longer timetable....
description: Following the defeat of his short timeline for the Withdrawal Agreement Bill on Tuesday night, Boris Johnson said he would wait for the EU to respond to the UK’s request for an extension under the Benn Act.
